title: Super Nintendo Entertainment System
summary: The Super Nintendo Entertainment System (SNES),[lower-alpha 2] commonly shortened to Super NES or Super Nintendo,[lower-alpha 3] is a 16-bit home video game console developed by Nintendo that was released in 1990 in Japan and South Korea,[17] 1991 in North America, 1992 in Europe and Oceania, and 1993 in South America. In Japan, the system is called the Super Famicom (SFC).[lower-alpha 4] In South Korea, it is known as the Super Comboy[lower-alpha 5] and was distributed by Hyundai Electronics.[18] The system was released in Brazil on August 30, 1993,[17][19] by Playtronic. Although each version is essentially the same, several forms of regional lockout prevent cartridges for one version from being used in other versions.
